result.execSummary:
The defendant Sarah M Neuenschwander was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--to pay restitution to Lions Quick Mart in the amount of $49,478.52

--to pay restitution to Federated Insurance (policy #9192759) in the amount of $25,000; this is to be converted to Civil Judgment

Per Standing Order Defendant is to pay the 5% & 10 % restitution surcharges

--to undergo any type assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent
--to maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no presence at any Lions Quick Mart property
--give DNA sample to designee upon demand

Arresting Agency: Fort Atkinson PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

FORTHWITH

ec: DOC[interface] (2/1/21--ma)
Petition for Civil Judgment for Restitution or Court Ordered Financial Obligations

[MK; Appearances are by Zoom conference] 
case called at 9:32am 
Defendant Sarah M Neuenschwander appears.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DOC Agent Jordann Kaufman appears.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance; victim R.L is present by audio. The Court invites  R.L. to un-mute and speak if R.L. wishes to make a statement, however there is no response.
Agent Kaufman voices the Department's position that Ms. Neuenschwander has made a good faith effort to pay; there have been consistent monthly payments up until the past few months. 
Ms. Neuenschwander makes a statement. She is currently laid-off of work due to the Covid pandemic.  
The Court does not extend Probation.
The Court converts the remaining amount of restitution owed to the victim to a civil judgment. 
The Court converts the court costs financial obligation to civil judgment. 
The Court indicates to the clerk that if further information from the Court is needed by the clerk in order to enter these civil judgments, then the clerk should notify the Court's JA of this. 
recess 9:40am.
Letter from Lions Quick Marts re defendants restitution
Routed to JA for further review. (ae/10/14/2020)
Probation review hearing on October 27, 2020 at 09:00 am. (Amended to convert to a Zoom hearing)
Probation review hearing on October 27, 2020 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 11:21am [mo]
[Restitution Hearing and Sentencing]
Defendant Sarah M Neuenschwander in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Ms. Neuenschwander

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 5 years with conditions:

--to serve 10 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence FORTHWITH
---Ms. Neuenschwander is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
--to undergo any type assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent
--to maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no presence at any Lions Quick Mart property
--to pay statutory costs
--to pay restitution to Lions Quick Mart in the amount of $49, 478.52
--to pay restitution to Federated Insurance(policy #9192759) in the amount of $25,000, this is to be converted to Civil Judgement
--give DNA sample to designee upon demand

Days credit for time already served:  0  days
Felony Firearm and Voting Prohibition Warnings given

The Court authorizes transfer of the conditional jail to Rock Co. so long as there is no use of electronic monitoring. 
recess:12:02pm
Sentencing Memorandum filed by the defense
with Criminal Case Settlement and JIs attatched

[Reserve Judge Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV: 
case called at 11:08am. 
Defendant Sarah M Neuenschwander in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court reviews the Criminal Case Settlement form with Ms. Neuenschwander, verifying that she understands and joins in the agreement. 
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance; she submits the victim impact statement and restitution request. 
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered; factual basis stipulated.  The Court accepts plea, finds Ms. Neuenschwander guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
The Court continues the Bond. 
recess 11:20am. 

NEXT:  Sentencing & Restitution Hearing on 11/19/15 at 11:00am (allow one hour)

Defendant Sarah M Neuenschwander in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Svehlek: Requests matter be set for plea hearing - are in process of having defense PSI prepared in due course
ADA Shock: agreed
Court confirms address on file is accurate & continues bond
Recess: 11:00 am

NEXT: (1) Schedule Plea Hearing 9/25/15 at 11:00 am - Send notices

case called at 3:24pm.  [MK]
Defendant Sarah M Neuenschwander in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $10,000 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no presence at Lions Quick Mart located at 1220 Janesville Avenue in Fort
--not to hold any employment or volunteer position that involves the direct handling of money
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking
recess 3:30pm
